name: Get specification of the installed executor

in_ports.name: executor_id
in_ports.caption: Executor ID
in_ports.hint: [Optional] Executor ID. If specified, it is used instead of "Executor ID" parameter

out_ports.name: settings_specification
out_ports.caption: settings specification
out_ports.hint:
If this executor has an associated settings specification JSON,
as settings, sub-chains or multi-chains,
it is returned, otherwise this port stays empty

out_ports.name: autogenerated_settings_specification
out_ports.caption: autogenerated settings specification
out_ports.hint: Settings specification JSON with the same controls as this executor

out_ports.name: id
out_ports.hint: Executor ID (equal to the "Executor ID" parameter)

out_ports.name: built_in
out_ports.hint:
Will contain "true" if this executor is built-in — it is a Java-executor, available directly after starting JVM.
Will contain "false" for extended executors like Python, JavaScript, sub-chains etc.

controls.caption: Executor ID
controls.name: id
controls.description: Unique identifier of the executor. Default value corresponds to this function itself.

controls.caption: Special search in built-in executors
controls.name: specialSearchInBuiltIn
controls.description: If set (default behaviour), this function checks built-in executors in the beginning. If cleared, all executors are checked in the same manner. For internal usage.
